intro: Peucedanum mazurevskii, commonly known as the Caucasian cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its seeds are small and ridged, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Peucedanum mazurevskii is valued for its aromatic properties and has been historically used in herbal remedies.
